intro: Guatteria dumetorum, commonly known as the dwarf guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a globose capsule that contains several seeds. Guatteria dumetorum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
